isis.stitle: STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, TILT/TELESCOPING - 2000, 4000, 8000 - STEERING WHEEL ALIGNMENT

svcproc.title: STEERING WHEEL ALIGNMENT
svcproc.para: Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment is designed into the steering assembly. Following are a few alignment points to check at assembly or when steering wheel alignment is a problem:

step1.para: Test drive vehicle on a straight and level (no crown) section of road for at least one quarter mile. Determine if or how far off center the steering wheel is when the vehicle is going straight.
If steering wheel alignment is off, return vehicle to work area for further adjustment. Stop vehicle with front road wheels (not steering wheel) straight ahead as indicated by driving test.

Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment can be accomplished by removing the steering wheel (refer to STEERING WHEEL), and re-indexing the steering wheel onto the splines of the steering column shaft.
Install the steering wheel (refer to STEERING WHEEL).
Test drive vehicle to assure that proper alignment has been accomplished and that steering is correct.
